enter_url: Enter the URL you want to manually add to the database
loading: Data is being retrieved from the server.
new_playlist_name: Enter a name for the new playlist

settings.need_help_setup_provider: Need help setting up this provider ?
settings.provider_name: Custom name for this provider entry
settings.sync_running: This provider is now being synchronized

log_level.label: Log level
log_level.description: Set the log verbosity for this provider.

flow_mode.label: Enable queue flow mode
flow_mode.description:
Enable "flow" mode where all queue tracks are sent as a continuous audio stream. 
Use for players that do not natively support gapless and/or crossfading or if the player has trouble transitioning between tracks.

output_channels.label: Output Channel Mode
output_channels.description: You can configure this player to play only the left or right channel, for example to create a stereo pair with 2 players.

volume_normalization_target.label: Target level for volume normalization
volume_normalization_target.description:
Adjust average (perceived) loudness to this target level, default is -17 LUFS 

 **WARNING:** Setting the level too high may result in clipping!

eq_bass.label: Equalizer: bass
eq_bass.description: Use the built-in basic equalizer to adjust the bass (low tones) level of the audio.

eq_mid.label: Equalizer: mid
eq_mid.description: Use the built-in basic equalizer to adjust the mid level of audio.

eq_treble.label: Equalizer: treble
eq_treble.description: Use the built-in basic equalizer to adjust the treble (high tones) level of audio.

crossfade.label: Enable crossfade
crossfade.description: Enable a crossfade transition between (queue) tracks.

crossfade_duration.label: Crossfade duration
crossfade_duration.description: Duration in seconds of the crossfade between tracks (if enabled)

hide_player.label: Hide this player in the user interface
hide_player.description:
Hide this player in the user interface. 

Note that it can still be controlled and it will also show up in any sync groups the player belongs to.

options.library_album_tracks: All tracks from all albums in the library

default_enqueue_select_album.description: If you want to play an album, what items should be enqueued?

options.all_tracks: All tracks for album on provider

default_enqueue_action_album.description: Define the default enqueue action for this media type (if you did not specify an action).

options.replace: Clear the queue and play the album track(s)

default_enqueue_action_radio.description: Define the default enqueue action for this media type (if you did not specify an action).

options.replace: Clear the queue and play the radio station

announce_volume_strategy.description: When an announcement is being broadcast to this player, how should the volume be adjusted temporarily (use in combination with the volume value below)?

announce_volume.description: The perceptual, relative or absolute volume level, used with the strategy for announcements.

icon.label: Icon
icon.description:
Material design icon for this player. 

See https://pictogrammers.com/library/mdi/.

settings.frontend_desc: Configuration settings for the Music Assistant User Interface (frontend). Note that these settings are stored at a device level.

menu_items.label: Enabled menu items
menu_items.description:
Configure which items to show in the menu.

 Note that if you disable settings you may lock yourself out. 

In that case you will need to manually enter the path to settings or clear the browser cookies to gain access again to settings, use at your own risk.

hide_settings.label: Hide settings button
hide_settings.description:
Hide settings button on home screen.

 Note that if you disable settings on the home screen and in the menu you may lock yourself out. 

In that case you will need to manually enter the path to settings or clear the browser cookies to gain access again to settings, use at your own risk!

settings.no_music_providers_detail: Start your Music Assistant experience by adding your Music providers.
settings.no_player_providers_detail: Configure player providers to select devices where Music Assistant can output your music.

sync_running: One or more music providers are being synchronized.

tooltip.refresh_new_content: New content is available, click to refresh the listing
tooltip.open_provider_link: Open this item on the provider's website

confirm_library_remove: Are you sure you want to delete this item from the library? Any items depending on this item will also be recursively removed. Note that this will only remove this item from the library. If this is a music file on disk, it may return on the next sync.
item_in_library: This item is available in the library
image_url: Input the URL to an image or icon (optional)
